section.title: Project Proposal Requirements
section.para: A project proposal should provide sufficient information to answer the questions below.

A project may be started based on a first draft of a proposal, even if some of these questions are left unanswered. In this case the project is only granted CVS-privileges later on, after a complete proposal is submitted and approved by the MMC. The idea here is to allow for a preliminary inception phase to investigate the feasability of the project and determine the scope.

1) Motivation
Why is this project necessary?
Why does this have to be an MMBase project instead of an external package? (package terminology)

2) Goal
What is the purpose of this project?
Which goals need to be achieved in order to consider the project completed?

3) Design
What are the key classes in the design. (Class diagram or -listing).
What area the key technologies used?
(Dependencies on external libraries; licences)
Which existing parts of MMBase are extended/leveraged?

4) Impact
Which existing parts of MMBase are modified? (Core/non-core)
Which new packages will be created? (core/non-core)
Are there backward compatibility issues? (which version required - release or CVS head)

5) Planning
What is the estimated planning and total duration of the project?
